September 12,19 62
Mr. Richard B. Hull, Director
Radio and TV Broadcasting
Ohio State University
215 West 19th Avenue
Columbus, Ohio
Dear Dick:
I hope sometime in the very near future you will have the
opportunity to read over my comments at Airlie House so I can
have your reactions and suggestions. I have just re-read the
material myself, and feel that it’s about what I would like to
say for the larger group at Philadelphia. Obviously it would
need to be adapted for the convention, because the original
was prepared especially for the Seminar; however, it embraces
most of my current thinking about the Association’s future and
with some polishing and omission of certain sections, seems
tome to provide the basic content for the presidential address.
I would like your frank appraisal and suggestions. I
don’t hold that the President must necessarily express the
views of the majority of the Board in addressing the conven¬
tion; nevertheless, I would prefer to be in general accord with
the Board’s attitude.
It was good to see you getting about again, even if it was
on three legs I
Cordially yours,
William G. Harley
